description.excerpt:
CubeViz is an OntoWiki component providing faceted browsing in statistical  
data in the Linked Data Web. It was set up and adopted to be part of the  
Data Portal of the European Union.  
CubeViz utilizing the  RDF DataCube vocabulary  
which is the state-of-the-art in representing statistical data in Resource Description Framework (RDF).  
This vocabulary is compatible with SDMX
Based on the vocabulary and the encoded Data Cube, CubeViz is generating a facetted browsing widget that

We providing a Docker container for everybody, who don't want to bother about getting OntoWiki running or struggles with Virtuoso. That container only needs a Docker and can be used with docker pull + docker run. How easy is that?!

For further information, please look in following the project page. 
Project page: Dockerizing/CubeViz

We created a comparison of CubeViz and other tools, which are supporting DataCube vocabulary. It is based on the support of elements which are mentioned in the vocabulary. The purpose of that overview is to provide users, who are interested in using CubeViz, further information of its DataCube vocabulary support in comparison to other tools.
| Supported Features                | CubeViz | OpenCube | LDCX | LSD Analysis    |

excerpt.body: This release contains _only non-code_ related changes, such as improvements of the README or new cubes.
This is a small maintenance release containing a [small fix](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/commit/3f64f74f461519f40ba666e4268571f0ca8221e2) and a couple of styling fixes.
Maintenance release with minor bug fixes. Upgrade only, if you experience errors in your existing installation.

**Final major release of CubeViz!** After a long time, almost a year, we finished CubeViz and brought it into a state to be proud of. After shaping and re-shaping, debugging and fixing, we reached the finish line to CubeViz 1.0, _hell yeah!_

This release is the result of the [master thesis](https://github.com/k00ni/masterthesis) from [Konrad Abicht](https://github.com/k00ni), the head developer of CubeViz. The major issue was to provide an user interface to merge two data sets for later comparison. Furthermore, the legend and visualization part of CubeViz was heavily reworked to provide more information about the data itself. 

### Compare User Interface

![](https://raw.github.com/wiki/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/images/compareActionScreenshot.png)

### New Observation List (Legend)

![](https://raw.github.com/wiki/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/images/NewObservationList.png)

**Jump to:**
- [**Solved issues**](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/issues?labels=&milestone=7&page=1&state=closed) in this release
- [**Download page**](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/releases/tag/1.0)
- [Installation introductions](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/Installation-and-setup-main)
- [Version 1.0 in a nutshell](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/About-releases#10)
- What changed between 0.9 and 1.0? [Here are the answers!](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/Upgrade-an-existing-installation#upgrade-from-09-to-10)

Major release of CubViz. It is an incremental release and if you already have CubeViz 0.8 in use, you should upgrade. Most of the changes affects the underlying system, mostly performance issues and bugs. 

Improving performance was the biggest issue. The developers of OntoWiki and Erfurt worked hard to speed up the Object- and QueryCache as well as the TitleHelper. Because of that, CubeViz now relies more on these technologies to handle database queries and store results. That means, CubeViz reuses results as much as possible which partly (dramatically) decreases the number of database queries.

**Jump to:**
- [Installation introductions](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/Installation-and-setup-main)
- [Version 0.9 in a nutshell](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/About-releases#09)
- What changed between 0.8 and 0.9? [Here are the answers!](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/Upgrade-an-existing-installation#upgrade-from-08-to-09)
- Fixed [issues](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/issues?milestone=6&page=1&state=closed)

### Outdated, please use at least CubeViz 0.9 or 1.0

****Warning**: This version contains bugs in slice-handling. If you rely on this functionality, please upgrade to CubeViz 0.9.**

This is an minor release of the **latest stable version 0.8** and fixes a problem with getting the cache directory from Erfurt library. 

It only matters to you, if you are using an up-to-date OntoWiki from develop branch or OntoWiki with version **0.9.10+**, with related **Erfurt 1.6+**.

**Jump to:**
- [Installation introductions](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/Installation-and-setup-main)
- [Version 0.8 in a nutshell](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/About-releases#08)
- What changed between 0.7 and 0.8? [Here are the answers!](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/Upgrade-an-existing-installation#upgrade-from-07-to-08)
- Fixed [issues](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/issues?milestone=5&state=closed)

support.excerpt:
The following list contains all elements of the DataCube vocabulary which are not supported by CubeViz (yet):


  *	**qb:ObservationGroup**: Indicates a group of observations. The domain of this property is left open so that a group may be attached to different resources and need not be restricted to a single DataSet.  
  *	**qb:CodedProperty**: Superclass of all coded component properties.  
  *	**qb:HierarchicalCodeList**: Represents a generalized hierarchy of concepts which can be used for coding. The hierarchy is defined by one or more roots together with a property which relates concepts in the hierarchy to their child concept . The same concepts may be members of multiple hierarchies provided that different qb:parentChildProperty values are used for each hierarchy.
  *	**qb:hierarchyRoot**: Specifies a root of the hierarchy. A hierarchy may have multiple roots but must have at least one.
  *	**qb:parentChildProperty**: Specifies a property which relates a parent concept in the hierarchy to a child concept. Note that a child may have more than one parent.
  *	**qb:componentAttachment**: Indicates the level at which the component property should be attached, this might be an qb:DataSet, qb:Slice or qb:Observation, or a qb:MeasureProperty.
  *	**qb:componentRequired:** Indicates whether a component property is required (true) or optional (false) in the context of a DSD. Only applicable to components corresponding to an attribute. Defaults to false (optional).  
  *	**qb:order**: Indicates a priority order for the components of sets with this structure, used to guide presentations - lower order numbers come before higher numbers, un-numbered components come last.
  *	**qb:concept**: Gives the concept which is being measured or indicated by a ComponentProperty.
  *	SKOS or SDMX related entities.

usage.excerpt:
You will find various information in our [Wiki](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/Home).
For new users, please visit Page [installation](https://github.com/AKSW/cubeviz.ontowiki/wiki/Installation-and-setup-main) 
to get an introduction about installation and setup of CubeViz.

Further information about the repository structure or other internals can be also found in the Wiki.
